quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movie and Film
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, country, length. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these movies is an all time favorite about a romance during World War II and stars film legends Humphrey Bogart and Ingrid Bergman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Casablanca

questions.question: Who were two of Spicolis stoner buds in the movie Fast Times at Ridgemont High?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anthony Edwards and Eric Stoltz

questions.question: The 2007 film adaptation of the graphic novel 300 was shot in 60 days.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the name of the 1941 movie starring Humphrey Bogart and Mary Astor in which a private eye is searching for a murderer and a jewelled bird?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Maltese Falcon

questions.question: The 2007 film 300 was losely based on the ancient Battle of Thermopylae. What does the name “Thermopylae” mean translated from Greek?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hot gateway

questions.question: In what country was the 2007 movie 300 filmed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Canada

questions.question: In the movie Fight Club, Tyler Durden is seen 3 times before the narrator glimpses him on the moving walkway at the airport.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: During the movie Fast Times at Ridgemont High, Linda becomes pregnant.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This 1948 movie portrays the life of an aspiring ballerina and her trials and tribulations professionally and personally and reflects a Hans Christian Anderson tale about ballet slippers. What is the name of this Academy Award-winning film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Red Shoes

questions.question: This 1944 Oscar-winning musical, starring Judy Garland under the direction of Vincente Minnelle, tells the story of four sisters living in St. Louis during the Louisiana Purchase Exposition Worlds Fair.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meet me in St. Louis

questions.question: In the movie 300, the Spartans wore virtually no armor. Was this the way actual Spartans went into battle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Rodrigo Santoro played King Xerxes in the 2007 film hit 300. What TV show did he appear in at the same time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lost

questions.question: What rating did the Motion Picture Association of America give to the 2007 hit movie 300?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: R

questions.question: Some of the fake names used by the narrator in the film Fight Club are names of the characters in Planet of the Apes, as well as characters played by which actor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert De Niro

questions.question: What is the length of the 2007 film adaptation of the graphic novel 300?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 117 minutes

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movie and Fight Club
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, roulette, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the 6th rule of Fight Club in the self-titled movie?

options.text: If this is your first night, you have to fight.
You do not talk about Fight Club.
Fights go on as long as they have to.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No shirts, no shoes.

questions.question: In the movie Ghost, Mollys hobby was sewing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the movie, Casablanca, who is the maître dhôtel of Ricks Café Americain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carl

questions.question: Before the car accident in Fight Club, Tyler Durden asks his passengers what they wish they would have done before they died. Stephs answers is Paint a self-portrait.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In Michael Curtizs movie, Casablanca, who arrives at Ricks club with the priceless letters of transit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ugarte

questions.question: After the car accident in the film Fight Club, the car is on its roof and Tyler Durden climbs out of which car door?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: passenger side

questions.question: In the movie Ghost, the main characters are Sam and Molly.  What are their last names?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wheat and Jensen

questions.question: What year did the movie Ghost premiere?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1990

questions.question: Who is the man Tyler Durden assaults behind the liquor store in the film Fight Club?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Raymond K. Hessel

questions.question: In the movie Ghost, Molly and Carl were going through a box of Sams things.  What goofy item did Molly want to keep that belonged to Sam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rolaids

questions.question: In the movie Ghost, the name used by Whoopi Goldbergs character in the bank scenes was Rita Smith?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the movie Ghost, when Molly would say I Love You what would Sam always say in return?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ditto

questions.question: In the movie Ghost, Sam was killed because his key card (password) was needed to obtain a certain dollar amount from the banking computer.  How much money was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: $4 million

questions.question: What is Ricks last name in the 1942 movie set during World War II, Casablanca?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blaine

questions.question: In the famous roulette scene in Casablanca, what number does Rick advise the young Hungarian man to bet on?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 22

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Casablanca and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, make-up, line. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the name of the Amish Bowler in Kingpin that Roy recruited to play in the Reno Open?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ishmael Boorg

questions.question: In what sport was Roy Munson crowned the 1979 Iowa State Champion in the movie Kingpin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bowling

questions.question: What song is Sam playing when Rick hides the letters of transit, in the movie classic, Casablanca?

options.text: Dream a Little Dream of Me

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Knock on Wood

questions.question: Ishmael Boorg, a character from the movie Kingpin, bowled against Ernie McCracken in the finals of the Reno Open.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What famous baseball pitcher played the role of Skidmark in the movie Kingpin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger Clemens

questions.question: What is the final line of the 1942 Michael Curtiz film, Casablanca?

options.text: Louis, this could be the start of a beautiful friendship.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis, this could be the start of a beautiful friendship.

questions.question: The first rule of eye make-up is that you can never wear enough blue eyeshadow is a quote from which film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My Girl

questions.question: Which famous brothers directed the 1996 movie Kingpin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bobby and Peter Farrelly

questions.question: What board game does Rick play throughout the 1942 film, Casablanca?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chess

questions.question: In Casablanca, what is the last name of the character portrayed by actress Ingrid Bergman, Ilsa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lund

questions.question: In the movie Kingpin, Roy Munson acquired what nickname because of his rubber hand?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rubber Man

questions.question: In the movie, Casablanca, the Bulgarian couple tell Louis that they will be at his office at 6:00 AM to make arrangements for their exit visas. What is Louis reply?

options.text: Ill be there, waiting on you.
Take your time. The planes are always late.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ill be there at 10.

questions.question: Who played the role of Ernie McCracken, Roys nemesis, in the movie Kingpin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Murray

questions.question: In the 1942 movie, Casablanca, who is the bartender at Ricks Café Americain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sascha

questions.question: In the famous movie, Casablanca, Ugarte is arrested at Ricks Cafe, but manages to escape.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movie and Line
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, line, s. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: You have another Question. Sure, I got one question for you. Its can you deal with that is taken from what film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meet the Parents

questions.question: Which movie featured the line I had a partner, I would have taken a bullet for him. You Im having a hard time not shooting?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: National Security

questions.question: Oh and remember, next Friday is Hawaiian shirt day. So, you know, if you want to, go ahead and wear a Hawaiian shirt and jeans is a quote from which of these films?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Office Space

questions.question: Which film is memorable for this quote?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bad Boys

questions.question: Why dont you wish in one hand and s**t in the other. See which one fills up first is a line from which movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bad Santa

questions.question: This piece of advice: Dont ever let someone tell you, you cant do something. Not even me. is offered in what movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pursuit of Happyness

questions.question: Hey, you stay away from the frozen foods section. Your boobsll harden is a bit of dialog from which movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Big Daddy

questions.question: Now the time has come. I put two bullets in my gun. One for me and one for you. Oh darling, it wil be so beautiful.  Can you name the movie in which this line was spoken?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Misery

questions.question: Can you name the movie from which this line is taken? What you have done is a felony for which you could be issued a fine or time in a state correctional facility.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Cable Guy

questions.question: I wasnt speaking to you Mr. Krendler. When I speak to you, youll know it because Ill look at you is a line taken from which film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hannibal

questions.question: From what film is this dialog taken?  I do wish we could chat longer, but.....Im having an old friend for dinner. Bye
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Silence of the Lambs

questions.question: The following quote is from which hit movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Home Alone

questions.question: You know, theres like a butt-load of gangs at this school. This one kept wanting me to join because Im pretty good with a bo staff.  In which movie can this line be heard?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Napoleon Dynamite

questions.question: In which film can you hear the following line? All right you proved your point. You broke into my vault. Congratulations, youre a dead man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oceans 11

questions.question: Which movie are you watching if you hear In my classroom, poetry is its own reward?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dangerous Minds

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Oscar and Tony
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This British actor who lived 1904- 2000 won his first Special Tony Award for his one man show Ages of Man(1959.) He won a regular Tony in 1961 for his directorial work on Big Fish, Little Fish. Most people know him for his Oscar-winning role as a butler who ....will alert the media! in 1981’s Arthur.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Gielgud

questions.question: Jonathan Tunick is among the few people who have won an Oscar, an Emmy, a Tony, and a Grammy although he not so well known. Which best describes his work?

options.text: He is a music composer and arranger.
He is a classical Shakespearean actor.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He is a music composer and arranger.

questions.question: He began as a writer on Sid Ceasars TV shows. He was Carl Reiners partner on the The 2,000 Year Old Man albums. One movie he wrote won him 3 Tonys (all in 2001), a 1968 Oscar, and two 2002 Grammys. Who is this comedic actor and writer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mel Brooks

questions.question: This man lived from 1902-1979. He won a 1962 Emmy for his work on Winston Churchill: The Valiant Years.” and a 1945 Oscar for his work on State Fair. He received Grammys in 1960 and 1962. He won 6 Tonys including three special awards. Who was this great great American composer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Rogers

questions.question: This star won a 2002 Day Time Emmy for “Beyond Tara: The Extraordinary Life of Hattie McDaniels. She won a 1985 Grammy for a comedy album. Her 2002 Tony was for Thoroughly Modern Milly.  Probably most famous, though, is her role as a “medium“ in a 1990 Patrick Swayze movie that won her an Oscar. Who is she?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Whoopie Goldberg

questions.question: Four Emmys!  Four Grammys! Three Oscars! But most people know him best for his one Tony - the 1976’s Tony for Best Musical Score for A Chorus Line. Who is this American composer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marvin Hamlisch

questions.question: One can wonder where this actress and singer puts so many awards: she has won 4 Emmys, 9 Grammys, 2 Oscars and one Tony. Her 1970 Tony was given to her for being Star of the Decade. Lainie Kazan was her stand-in for “Funny Girl. Who is this American legend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barbra Streisand

questions.question: From which movie does this line come Its not unusual for a child to create an imaginary friend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hide and Seek

questions.question: A Belgian-born British actress, this Broadway stage performer won an Emmy in 1993 and a Grammy in 1994. She won a 1954 Tony for her acting in Ondine” and a 1968 Tony Special Award. She won the 1953 Best Actress Oscar for Roman Holiday” and the Jean Hersholt Humanitarian Award (an Oscar) in 1993. Who was this beauty?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Audrey Hepburn

questions.question: In 1965 this American singer and actress won her first Tony for her work on Flora the Red Menace. Her Oscar came in 1972 for Cabaret.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liza Minelli

questions.question: Name the director of The Graduate,  Monty Python’s Spamalot,” and Wit” who started as part of a comedy duo with Elaine May and went on to become the first director to have won an Oscar, an Emmy, a Tony, and a Grammy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Nichols

questions.question: The movie Kramer vs Kramer was released in 1978.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What 1979 movie starring Faye Dunaway had this tagline:  The most poignant love-triangle of all - a father, his son, and the woman who came between them.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Champ

questions.question: This First lady of the American stage lived 1900-1993. She won her first Oscar in 1932 (The Sin of Madelon Claudet.) Her first Tony came in 1947 for her work in Happy Birthday.” She won a 1952 Emmy and a 1976 Grammy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Helen Hayes

questions.question: This fabulous woman was the first actor to qualify for the category of the winners of an Oscar, an Emmy, a Tony, and a Grammy. She won her Oscar in 1961 for best Supporting Actress  for her role in a musical, set in New York City.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rita Moreno

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Movie and The Color Purple
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, line, shug. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the name of the song Shug writes and sings for Miss Celie in the movie The Color Purple?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miss Celies Blues

questions.question: In the movie The Color Purple, when Nettie is thrown off Misters farm and Celie begs Nettie to write her, what is Netties response?

options.text: that nothing but death can keep her from it
that she cant read or write
that she cant afford the postage
that she is afraid Mister will find out

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: that nothing but death can keep her from it

questions.question: In the movie The Color Purple, what does Miss Celie make and sell to support herself after she leaves Mister?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pants

questions.question: Who turned down the the role of Shug Avery in the movie The Color Purple?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tina Turner

questions.question: What Disney movie contains the line, A fine conscience I turned out to be!?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pinocchio

questions.question: In the movie The Color Purple, who quoted the line, a girl child aint safe in a family of men?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sofia

questions.question: In the movie The Color Purple, what does Shug say will happen if you walk by a field of purple and dont notice it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It makes God angry.

questions.question: What actress portrayed Miss Celie in the movie The Color Purple?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Whoopi Goldberg

questions.question: In the movie The Color Purple, what happens to Miss Celies son and daughter?

options.text: They both left home to attend college.
They were adopted and lived in Africa.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They were adopted and lived in Africa.

questions.question: What 1974 movie depicts the story of a young wife and mothers (Gena Rowlands) erratic behavior which leads her husband (Peter Falk) to commit her for psychiatric treatment because he fears what he doesnt understand?

options.text: When A Man Loves A Woman

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Woman Under The Influence

questions.question: In what state does the classic movie The Color Purple take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Georgia

questions.question: In the movie The Color Purple, Shugs father built and ran the Juke Joint that was located back in the woods.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In The Color Purple, Oprah Winfreys character Shug Avery, helps Miss Celie cope with life as a black woman in the 1930s in the deep south.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What year was the 11 Oscar nominated movie The Color Purple released?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1985

questions.question: Who directed the dramatic movie The Color Purple?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steven Spielberg
